definition: to misjudge/error of judgment/incorrect ruling/miscarriage of justice

sentences.english: You saw the goal disallowed the other day in the Championship.
sentences.chinese: 你可以看到在歐冠賽場上曾有的誤判。

sentences.english: This drastically reduces the chances of false positives or false negatives.
sentences.chinese: 這樣可以大大減少誤判或漏判的機會。

sentences.english: The failure of motorists to detect and recognize motorcycles in traffic is the predominating cause of motorcycle accidents.
sentences.chinese: 駕駛員的錯誤判斷是造成摩托車事故的主要因素。

sentences.english: You should know that difference a slight misjudgment of the positioning of your foot.
sentences.chinese: 你應該知道的差異略有誤判的定位，您的腳。

sentences.english: Yet even where the evidence is presented impeccably, ignoring the base-rate effect can lead to miscarriages of justice.
sentences.chinese: 即使證據顯得無可置疑，忽略基礎概率也會導致誤判。

sentences.english: The restructure was brought on by a series of recent misjudgments.
sentences.chinese: 這次重組是由近來的一連串錯誤判斷引起的。

sentences.english: Airlines thatrefit planes are running a risk of misjudging the market.
sentences.chinese: 改裝飛機的航空公司正冒着誤判市場的風險。

sentences.english: And that raises the possibility of more provocations — and potential miscalculations — ahead.
sentences.chinese: 這會導致更多挑釁和潛在誤判的可能性增加。

sentences.english: Familiarity with artifacts is essential to avoid misdiagnoses.
sentences.chinese: 熟悉各種假象對避免誤判是十分必要的。

sentences.english: While Venus retrogrades , there is always the possibility of a miscommunication or error in judgment regarding romance.
sentences.chinese: 金星的逆行，總會伴隨這對羅曼蒂克錯誤判斷。
其實，我錯誤判斷了父母。

sentences.english: He claims he was wrongfully convicted and his appeal will be heard next year.
sentences.chinese: 他聲稱自己被誤判並將於明年提請上訴。
這是一次危險的錯誤判斷。

sentences.english: I'm not sure there was any real danger – I think just misjudged it and headed it in.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道是否真的有威脅，我想迪達內誤判了。

sentences.english: Another major cause of wrongful convictions is false confessions.
sentences.chinese: 另一項主要的誤判原因就是假供。

sentences.english: Used to whitelist sender addresses which send mail that is often tagged (incorrectly) as spam.
sentences.chinese: 它用於指定通常被誤判爲發送的垃圾郵件的發信地址。

definition: (of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to turn a blind eye to
